verbs.description: archaize (third-person singular simple present archaizes, present participle archaizing, simple past and past participle archaized) (American spelling, Oxford British English)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To give an archaic quality or character to; make archaic, to suggest the past.
examples: The statue had an archaized quality to it.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To speak, write, etc. in an archaic manner.
